title: Web Accessibility Testing, Part 2: Basic Methods and Tools
description: An in-depth review and practice of testing websites and web-based applications for conformance to major accessibility standards including automatic, manual, and use case testing. This course is designed to cover the following basic topics: - Overview of testing techniques and methodologies - Assembling a best practices guide - Determining test sets, conformance criteria, and test approach - Automated testing approaches - Performing manual testing, including code review and assistive technology testing - Use case testing - Testing with screen readers (JAWS, NVDA, VoiceOver) - Reporting, remediation, and regression
prerequisites: Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is helpful
